author: Jonathan Cheng
title: South Korea’s ‘Garlic Girls’ Take Home Silver in Curling Final
text:
GANGNEUNG, South Korea—South Korea’s beloved women’s curling team ran out of magic in the closely watched final on Sunday but emerged with a silver medal—and with the Olympic host nation’s most improbable feel-good story line.
South Korea’s “Garlic Girls,” a nickname the domestic press has given them for their garlic-producing hometown of Uiseong, lost 8-3 to a Swedish team that was efficient in its ruthlessness.
Sweden...
